titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1628_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1628_01

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

ḥg-n k-wqh nšʾkrb yʾmn yhrḥb mlk sbʾ w-ḏ-rydn bn ʾlšrḥ yḥḍb w-yʾzl
byn mlky sbʾ w-ḏ-rydn ʾdm-hw mrṯdm w-ʾslm w-bny-hmw šrḥm bny ḏ-mʾḏnm w-šʿb-hmw mʾḏnm

yhʾsyn kḥ..m ...frm m fʾw bqrm f-l-ʾblm l-yḏbḥnn wdm ḫms qnym
ṯwrm ydwm flqnyn w-ḏ-yhʾsyn f-ḥṣm

byn mlky sbʾ w-ḏ-rydn ʾdm-hw mrṯdm w-ʾslm w-bny-hmw šrḥm bny ḏ-mʾḏnm w-šʿb-hmw mʾḏnm

1.Thus have [… … Nasha]ʾkari[b Yuʾmin] Yuharḥib, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, son of ʾĪlsharaḥ Yaḥḍub and Yaʾzil 2.Bayyin, the two Kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, for [his clients] Marthadum and ʾAslam and their son Sharaḥum of the lineage of Dhū-Miʾdhanum and their tribe [of Miʾdhanum,] 3.their council and their overlords--great and small--(regarding) every legal dispute and legal settlement and legal procedure(?) regarding transport animals and livestock ownership in the valley of Ḥara- 4.d-all camels and cattle and (other) livestock-against any harm, damage, destruction, or wrongdoing within that valley of Ḥarad, from (the area of) the temple of Dhū-[… …] 5.up to the plantation of Fahdum which is in the region [… … …] the valley of Ḥarad, as [… …] and the two earthen levees in Ḥal[.]hān and [.]nqul[… …] 6.they send [… … … … … …] or cattle or camels in order to be slaughtered for (the god) Waddum: five small [livestock … …] 7.a bull, [… … …] the small livestock which they send, then harm [… …].

Thus have … … Nashaʾkarib Yuʾmin Yuharḥib, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, son of ʾĪlsharaḥ Yaḥḍub and Yaʾzil
Bayyin, the two Kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, for his clients Marthadum and ʾAslam and their son Sharaḥum of the lineage of Dhū-Miʾdhanum and their tribe of Miʾdhanum,
their council and their overlords--great and small--regarding every legal dispute and legal settlement and legal procedure? regarding transport animals and livestock ownership in the valley of Ḥara-
d-all camels and cattle and other livestock-against any harm, damage, destruction, or wrongdoing within that valley of Ḥarad, from the area of the temple of Dhū-… …
up to the plantation of Fahdum which is in the region … … … the valley of Ḥarad, as … … and the two earthen levees in Ḥal.hān and .nqul… …
they send … … … … … … or cattle or camels in order to be slaughtered for the god Waddum: five small livestock … …
a bull, … … … the small livestock which they send, then harm … ….

Thus have … … Nashaʾkarib Yuʾmin Yuharḥib, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, son of ʾĪlsharaḥ Yaḥḍub and Yaʾzil
Bayyin, the two Kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, for his clients Marthadum and ʾAslam and their son Sharaḥum of the lineage of Dhū-Miʾdhanum and their tribe of Miʾdhanum,

d-all camels and cattle and other livestock-against any harm, damage, destruction, or wrongdoing within that valley of Ḥarad, from the area of the temple of Dhū-… …
up to the plantation of Fahdum which is in the region … … … the valley of Ḥarad, as … … and the two earthen levees in Ḥal.hān and .nqul… …
they send … … … … … … or cattle or camels in order to be slaughtered for the god Waddum: five small livestock … …
a bull, … … … the small livestock which they send, then harm … ….

Thus have … … Nashaʾkarib Yuʾmin Yuharḥib, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, son of ʾĪlsharaḥ Yaḥḍub and Yaʾzil
Bayyin, the two Kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, for his clients Marthadum and ʾAslam and their son Sharaḥum of the lineage of Dhū-Miʾdhanum and their tribe of Miʾdhanum,
their council and their overlords--great and small--regarding every legal dispute and legal settlement and legal procedure? regarding transport animals and livestock ownership in the valley of Ḥara-
d-all camels and cattle and other livestock-against any harm, damage, destruction, or wrongdoing within that valley of Ḥarad, from the area of the temple of Dhū-… …
up to the plantation of Fahdum which is in the region … … … the valley of Ḥarad, as … … and the two earthen levees in Ḥal.hān and .nqul… …
they send … … … … … … or cattle or camels in order to be slaughtered for the god Waddum: five small livestock … …
a bull, … … … the small livestock which they send, then harm … ….
